content.question: A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION. You are permitted to use your calculator to solve an equation, find the derivative of a function at a point, or calculate the value of a definite integral. However, you must clearly indicate the setup of your question, namely the equation, function, or integral you are using. If you use other built-in features or programs, you must show the mathematical steps necessary to produce your results. Your work must be expressed in standard mathematical notation rather than calculator syntax. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="f"><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></math> be the continuous function defined on <math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 7, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> whose graph, consisting of two line segments, is shown above. Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="h"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the functions defined by <math alttext="g of x equals, open parenthesis, x squared, plus 5 x, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="h of x equals, 7 times cosine x, plus, x cubed"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) The function <math alttext="N"><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></math> is defined by <math alttext="N of x equals, f of x, times, g of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="N prime of negative 1"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text: A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION. You are permitted to use your calculator to solve an equation, find the derivative of a function at a point, or calculate the value of a definite integral. However, you must clearly indicate the setup of your question, namely the equation, function, or integral you are using. If you use other built-in features or programs, you must show the mathematical steps necessary to produce your results. Your work must be expressed in standard mathematical notation rather than calculator syntax. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="f"><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></math> be the continuous function defined on <math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 7, close bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> whose graph, consisting of two line segments, is shown above. Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="h"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the functions defined by <math alttext="g of x equals, open parenthesis, x squared, plus 5 x, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="h of x equals, 7 times cosine x, plus, x cubed"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) The function <math alttext="N"><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></math> is defined by <math alttext="N of x equals, f of x, times, g of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="N prime of negative 1"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(b) The function <math alttext="P"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></math> is defined by <math alttext="P of x equals, the fraction with numerator g of x, and denominator 5 times f of x, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="P prime of 4"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(c) Find the value of <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 3, less than x, less than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, h prime of x"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 2.7: Derivatives of cos x, sin x, ex, and ln x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
